revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta2)
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Vanessa Bayer | image = Vanessa Bayer at LOL for LLS 0.04.jpg | caption = Bayer at 2015 benefit for the [[Leukemia & Lymphoma Society]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|11|14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/about/bio/vanessa-bayer|title=Vanessa Bayer - About - Saturday Night Live - NBC|work=[[Saturday Night Live]]|accessdate=June 17, 2014}} | birth_place = [[Orange, Ohio|Orange]], [[Ohio]], [[United States of America|U.S.]] | education = [[University of Pennsylvania]] | occupation = {{flat list| *Actress *Comedian }} | years_active = 2009–present }} '''Vanessa Bayer''' (born {{start date|1981|11|14}}) is an American actress and comedian, best known as a cast member on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', for which she earned a [[Primetime Emmy]] nomination as well as for supporting roles in the films ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'' (2015), ''[[Office Christmas Party]]'' (2016), ''[[Carrie Pilby (film)|Carrie Pilby]]'' (2016), and ''[[Ibiza (film)|Ibiza]]'' (2018). ==Early life== Bayer was born and raised in [[Orange, Ohio]], a suburb of [[Cleveland]], to a [[Reform Jewish]] family.Moynihan, Rob. "''SNL'''s Fab Four", ''[[TV Guide]]'', March 7, 2011, Pages 44-45 She is the daughter of Carolyn (née Polster) and Todd Bayer.[http://www.orangeschools.org/news/view/334 Vanessa Bayer] from the [[Orange High School (Ohio)|Orange High School]] website She has a brother, Jonah, who is a music journalist and the drummer for the punk supergroup [[United Nations (band)|United Nations]].{{cite web|last1=Eakin|first1=Marah|title=Jonah and Vanessa Bayer on Sound Advice, sibling rivalries, and childhood bribery|url=https://www.avclub.com/jonah-and-vanessa-bayer-on-sound-advice-sibling-rivalr-1798282072|website=The A.V. Club|accessdate=20 December 2017}}{{cite web|title=Watch Vanessa Bayer Roast United Nations|url=https://www.stereogum.com/1697183/watch-vanessa-bayer-roast-united-nations/video/|website=Stereogum|accessdate=20 December 2017|date=6 August 2014}} At the age of 15, she was diagnosed with [[leukemia]]. Bayer stated that while battling the disease, she discovered the meaning of “[[comic relief]]”. “I don’t know if it made me funnier, but it was so amazing, how it made everything be O.K.,” she said.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/nyregion/the-very-lazy-sunday-routine-of-vanessa-bayer-of-saturday-night-live.html?_r=0|title=The (Very Lazy) Sunday Routine of Vanessa Bayer of ‘Saturday Night Live’|last=Correal|first=Annie|date=May 7, 2016|website=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|access-date=October 30, 2016}} Bayer graduated from [[Orange High School (Ohio)|Orange High School]] in 2000{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.cleveland.com/dining/index.ssf/2012/11/saturday_night_lives_vanessa_b.html |title='Saturday Night Live' regular Vanessa Bayer, a Moreland Hills native, returns home to perform Sunday at the Improv |publisher=cleveland.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-03}} and attended the [[University of Pennsylvania]], where she majored in communication and French,{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/features/leisure/entertainment/article_4548880c-3335-11e2-bf5a-0019bb2963f4.html |title=For Saturday Night Live’s Bayer, humor a family affair - Cleveland Jewish News: Entertainment |publisher=Cleveland Jewish News |date=2012-11-20 |accessdate=2013-10-03}} graduating in 2004. ==Career== As of 2012, Bayer was collaborating with her brother Jonah on the [[web series]] ''Sound Advice'' for [[Above Average Productions|Above Average]]. Bayer stars as Janessa Slater, a media coach who helps famous musicians change their image.{{cite web|url=http://www.upenn.edu/gazette/0511/pro03.html |title=Penn Gazette | Alumni : Profiles |publisher=Upenn.edu |date= |accessdate=2012-09-22}}{{cite web|author=|url=http://jonahbayer.wordpress.com |title=Jonah Bayer |publisher=Jonahbayer.wordpress.com |date=2010-09-21 |accessdate=2012-09-22}}{{Cite news|url=https://noisey.vice.com/en_us/article/vb7953/octobers-very-owned-ep-16-an-interview-with-a-guy-who-hung-out-with-drake-for-two-hours-once|title=An Interview with a Guy Who Hung Out with Drake for Two Hours Once|date=2017-10-16|work=Noisey|access-date=2017-10-17|language=en-us}} While attending college, Bayer interned on the television shows ''[[Sesame Street]]'' and ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'' and participated in the cast of ''Bloomers'', an all-female musical and sketch comedy troupe.{{cite web|url=http://www.bloomerscomedy.com |title=All-Female Musical and Sketch Comedy at the University of Pennsylvania |publisher=Bloomers Comedy |date= |accessdate=2012-09-22}} Bayer was part of the all-Jewish cast of [[The Second City|Second City]]'s stage show ''Jewsical: The Musical'', a musical that presented a comedic take on Jewish life and culture.{{cite web|url=http://letmypeoplegrow.org/2011/02/jews-newsrachel-specter-grammys-snl/ |title=Jews in the News: Rachel Specter, Grammys & Barbra Streisand|publisher=Letmypeoplegrow.org|accessdate=2012-09-22}} Bayer played the role of Kate Clark in the Chicago-based feature comedy ''Off the Cuff''.{{cn|date=December 2017}} Bayer performed [[improvisational]] comedy at Chicago's [[ImprovOlympic]], where she trained with ''SNL'' castmate [[Paul Brittain]] as well as the [[Annoyance Theatre]] and [[The Second City|Second City]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcuniversal.presscentre.com/content/detail.aspx?ReleaseID=1683&NewsAreaId=2|title=NBC'S 'SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE' PREMIERES SEPTEMBER 25 WITH SNL ALUM AMY POEHLER & CHART-TOPPING MUSICAL GUEST KATY PERRY|publisher=NBC-Universal Press Release|date=September 17, 2010|accessdate=2012-09-22|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120311215526/http://www.nbcuniversal.presscentre.com/content/detail.aspx?ReleaseID=1683&NewsAreaId=2|archive-date=March 11, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} ===''Saturday Night Live''=== Bayer joined the cast of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' as a featured player on September 25, 2010. Beginning with the 2012–2013 season, Bayer was promoted to repertory status. She has been praised for her performance on the show, with [[HitFix]] calling her "one of the strongest members of the ensemble"{{Verify quote|date=July 2017}} and ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' calling her "''Saturday Night Live's'' secret weapon".{{Verify quote|date=July 2017}} In 2014, she was nominated for an [[American Comedy Award]] for her work on the show.{{cn|date=December 2017}} Bayer departed SNL on May 20, 2017 after seven years on the show. She held the record of the show's longest-serving female cast member, with 149 episodes ([[Maya Rudolph]], who had been a cast member for 9 seasons, stayed for 146 episodes).{{cite web|url=https://news.avclub.com/vanessa-bayer-is-leaving-snl-1798262112|title=Vanessa Bayer is leaving SNL|first=William|last=Hughes|publisher=}} {{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/20/entertainment/vanessa-bayer-leaving-snl/|title=Vanessa Bayer leaving 'SNL'|publisher=CNN|date=May 21, 2017|accessdate=2017-05-22}} She was nominated for a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]] for that season.{{cite web | url = http://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2017/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-comedy-series | title = Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series - 2017 | publisher = [[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences]] | location = Los Angeles | accessdate = 2017-07-13 }} Her recurring characters include: * Laura Parsons, a child actress always performing roles originally played by adults, including from ''[[Forrest Gump]]'', ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]'', ''[[Brokeback Mountain]]'', and ''[[Dallas Buyers Club]]'' * Brecky, a former porn star who creates homemade commercials to obtain free luxury items alongside [[Cecily Strong]] * Rebecca Stern-Markowicz, a co-host of ''[[J-Pop America Fun Time Now]]'' which celebrates Japanese culture alongside [[Taran Killam]] and [[Jason Sudeikis]] * Miss Meadows, an unrealistically perky poetry teacher trying to connect with her delinquent students * An unnamed director of talk show ''Mornin' Miami'' * Jacob the Bar Mitzvah Boy, who appears on ''[[Weekend Update]]'' to perform a rehearsed speech (complete with forced jokes) about a given subject * [[Rachel Green]] from the sitcom ''[[Friends]]'' (and other characters from the show) * One of two workshop elves who perform their jobs poorly in the hope that their master will "punish" them, alongside [[Kenan Thompson]] * An unnamed housewife who makes [[Totino's|Totinos]] for her "hungry guys". * Dawn Lazarus, an inept meteorologist who appears on ''[[Weekend Update]]'' and struggles to discuss the weather. * Maggie Margaret Bond, whose "walking music" may be unflattering, in SNL's [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Quqfky-zpvA "Soap Opera Reunion"]. ==Philanthropy== Bayer suffered from leukemia as a teenager. The [[Make-A-Wish Foundation]] granted her wish to send her family on vacation to [[Hawaii]]. As a former "Make-A-Wish kid", Bayer continues to do work with the foundation. In 2015, she hosted the foundation's "Evening of Wishes Dinner" to help raise funds for wishes for children with life-threatening illnesses.{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/06/22/vanessa-bayer-reveals-childhood-struggle-leukemia|publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|edition=online|title=Vanessa Bayer talks to People about her childhood struggle with leukemia|last=Daley|first=Megan|date=2015-06-22|accessdate=2016-09-19}} ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |+ Films |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Role ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Notes |- |align="center"| 2009 || ''Off the Cuff'' || Kate Clark || |- |align="center"| 2010 || ''Stages of Emily'' || Jocelyn || Short film |- |align="center"| 2012 || ''Adventures in the Sin Bin'' || Superdawg Waitress || |- |align="center"| 2013 || ''[[Despicable Me 2]]'' || Flight Attendant || Voice role |- |align="center"| 2015 || ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'' || Nikki || |- |rowspan="2" align="center"| 2016 || ''[[Carrie Pilby (film)|Carrie Pilby]]'' || Tara || |- | ''[[Office Christmas Party]]'' || Allison || |- |align="center"| 2017 || ''[[The Polka King]]'' || Bitsy Bear || |- |align="center"|2018 || ''[[Ibiza (film)|Ibiza]]'' || Nikki || |- |} {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |+ Television |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Role ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Notes |- |align="center"| 2010–17 || ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' || Various || Series regular
Nominated – [[American Comedy Awards|2014 American Comedy Award for Comedy Supporting Actress - TV]]
Nominated – 2014 Online Film & Television Association Award for Best Female Performance in a Fiction Program
Nominated – 2015 Online Film & Television Association Award for Best Female Performance in a Fiction Program
Nominated – [[69th Primetime Emmy Awards]] ("[[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series|Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series]]") |- |align="center"| 2011 || ''I Wanna Have Your Baby'' || Connie || Episode: "Corrine & Jerry" |- |align="center"| 2012 || ''Sugarboy'' || Chip's wife || |- |align="center"| 2013 || ''[[The Mindy Project]]'' || Mary || Episode: "Sk8er Man" |- |align="center"| 2014 || ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' || Susan Armhold || Episode: "Patton Oswalt Wears a Black Blazer & Dress Shoes" |- |align="center"| 2014–15 || ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]'' || Various || Episodes: "Sharing Finances", "Late in Life Drug Use", "You Can Call Me Al" and "The Storytellers" |- |align="center"| 2015 || ''[[Man Seeking Woman]]'' || Laura || Episodes: "Traib" and "Lizard" |- |align="center"| 2015 || ''[[The Awesomes]]'' || Dr. Jill Stein-Awesome-Kaplan || 4 episodes |- |align="center"| 2016 || ''[[Modern Family]]'' || Marjorie || Episode: "Snow Ball" |- |align="center"| 2016–18 || ''[[Drunk History]]'' || Various || 2 episodes |- |align="center"| 2017 || ''[[The Simpsons]]'' || Dr. Clarity Hoffman-Roth (voice) || Episode: "[[A Father's Watch]]" |- |align="center"| 2018 || ''[[Love (TV series)|Love]]'' || Sarah || Episode: "[[List of Love episodes#ep29|Sarah from College]]" |- |align="center"| 2018 || ''[[Will & Grace]]'' || Amy || Episode: "The Beefcake & the Cake Beef" |} ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=31em}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|3364779}} * {{Rotten Tomatoes person|Vanessa_Bayer}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bayer, Vanessa}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from Cleveland]] [[Category:Cancer survivors]] [[Category:Jewish American actresses]] [[Category:Jewish comedians]] [[Category:Jewish female comedians]] [[Category:People from Cuyahoga County, Ohio]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:American impressionists (entertainers)]] [[Category:American voice actresses]] [[Category:American sketch comedians]] [[Category:Comedians from Ohio]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
